dt: {bc}viewed or acting in dissociation from all else

pt: {sc}steep{/sc} {sc}abrupt{/sc} {sc}precipitous{/sc} {sc}sheer{/sc} mean having an incline approaching the perpendicular. {sc}steep{/sc} implies such sharpness of pitch that ascent or descent is very difficult.
{sc}abrupt{/sc} implies a sharper pitch and a sudden break in the level.
{sc}precipitous{/sc} applies to an incline approaching the vertical.

pt.t: the river winds through a {it}precipitous{/it} gorge

et: Middle English {it}schere{/it} freed from guilt, probably alteration of {it}skere{/it}, from Old Norse {it}skærr{/it} pure; akin to Old English {it}scīnan{/it} to shine
shortdef: being free from an adulterant : pure, unmixed
viewed or acting in dissociation from all else
